job_description: Creating SPICE-level compact models for nanopore field effect transistors (NPFETs) and gate-exposed FinFETs (BIOFETs)What you will doThe progress in CMOS process technology enabled to manufacture nano-scale Field-Effect Transistors (FETs). This has opened doors not just for better computing but also for bio-sensing area, such as proteins and DNA sensors. Massive parallelization, enabled by large-scale integration, can be used for analysing biological systems, resulting in more complete view of a biological system at a reasonable cost. The design of such large sensors arrays takes advantage of the IC design flow and SPICE-level model must be developed for bio-sensors as well. In this postdoc position, you will create SPICE-level compact model for nanopore field effect transistors (NPFETs) and gate-exposed FinFETs (BIOFETs). The compact model will be based on TCAD models and measurements of existing devices. The model will be used to simulate and optimize the signal and noise response of complete large-scale sensor systems. This model will also form the basis of the theoretical exploration of different measurement strategies.  This topic requires understanding of semiconductor physics, experimental biosensor device, and basics of circuit design. You will therefore interact closely with device and integration experts, TCAD modelling experts, and circuit specialists.  What we do for youWe offer you the opportunity to join one of the worldâs premier research centers in nanotechnology at its headquarters in Leuven, Belgium.
